history.content:
This should be relatively doable - I don't mean to deny the hardness of taking two finals back to back, but this is a fairly common occurrence at Berkeley, and shouldn't really influence your choice of classes imo

Oh boy, it looks like those are the very two last final exam slots. I feel sorry for the 170 staff already.

The fact that the exams themselves are consecutive shouldn't be too bad; just make sure to start studying for both sufficiently early instead of waiting because the exams are so late. (The 188 exam is traditionally a cumulative exam, so try not to forget too much from the previous midterms.)

This should be relatively doable - I don't mean to deny the hardness of taking two finals back to back, but this is a fairly common occurrence at Berkeley, and shouldn't really influence your choice of classes imo

Hi,

To my knowledge CS170 and CS188 have a back to back final in the Spring 2017 semester. I'm planning on taking both of these classes next semester (along with Physics 7B and History 100AC). I would just like to know if others feel this is doable, or if perhaps I should switch one of the courses to a different semester to avoid this.

Thanks!
history.subject: CS170 and CS188 Spring Final Times
